result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jovonie Santos Rivera

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Request for Substitution of Judge Crivello, Branch 36

Defendant Jovonie Santos Rivera appeared by video.  Attorney John j Forrestal appeared by video for Jovonie Santos Rivera.  Attorney Thomas Hasle in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 36, Judge Crivello. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense requested for Substitution of Judge. Court consented to substitution against Judge Crivello. Defendant is advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Childs, Br. 02. Court ordered case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 02. Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jovonie Santos Rivera in court.  Attorney John j Forrestal in court for Jovonie Santos Rivera.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel was recently retained and requests a preliminary hearing. Defendant waived time limits for Preliminary Hearing. Court reiterated conditions of bail with the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. PE.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 094253,
Payable Number: 1036684,
Receipt Number: 22RP039813,
Amount: $20.00
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Status Report 9-12-2022

CASE HEARD IN BR. 37 FOR Br. 36
Defendant Jovonie Santos Rivera in court.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for an indigency hearing. Defendant is looking to retain private counsel and requests more time to meet with attorneys of interest. Court adjourns matter for a status of counsel.  Case remains calendared in Br. 36.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-23-2022

Defendant Jovonie Santos Rivera in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Mr Rivera is not eligible for SPD appointment of counsel. Defendant appears without counsel. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.   
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316 Safety Bldg.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license and insurance.

Defendant Jovonie Santos Rivera in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Jovonie Santos Rivera in custody.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jovonie Santos Rivera appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending matter, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
